turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm thinking of joining a hackathon, but I'm feeling a bit overwhelmed. I've never done one before. Any advice on where to even start?

turns.speaker: agent

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, that makes sense. I'm really into AI and machine learning. Finding a team is another worry... I don't have many friends who are into coding.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Great! Many hackathons have team formation events or online forums where you can connect with other participants who are also looking for teammates. turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yes, please! But here's a tricky one: how do I protect my IP if I develop something cool during the hackathon? I don't want the organizers or other participants stealing my ideas.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, searching for AI/ML themed hackathons... I've found a few potential matches. Regarding IP protection, generally, you retain the rights to what you create during the hackathon unless explicitly stated otherwise in the hackathon's rules. Read the fine print carefully before registering! Some hackathons might have clauses about licensing your code for their use (usually non-commercial). If you create something you think is valuable, consider documenting your process and code meticulously. Timestamping your work can also help. However, for official legal advice, you should consult with an attorney specializing in intellectual property law.
